Long, long time ago, I started playing Portal. I quit after a couple of hours. I guess I wasn't in the mood or whatever.
I picked it up yesterday and finished it today.

I can finally understand all the hype and love this game gets. It's Valve as we know it - offering something new and creative, yet fun and lovable. Every person who has ever touched a mouse and a keyboard should at least give this game a try.


Pros:
Atmoshpere
Simplicity
Physics

Cons:
Not aware of any

Neutral:
I feel like you have to complete it to be able to appreciate it. If you stop half-way through, you will never understand why this game is loved in the gaming community.

I give it 9/10

I saw this game on a sale for 1.99 USD and went and purchased it! Glad I did! The 4 hours it took me to get threw the main campaign was totally worth it! There is bonus content that is free but I haven't gotten to that yet. 
Although this game is pretty old it supports 4K. I was able to run at 4k 60fps at some points with it dipping into the low 40s with maxed settings on a Ryzen 3200G with integrated graphics. I ended up running at 1080 with maxed settings to see how high the fps would go... It was in the 200s but I locked it at 60 so FreeSync would prevent screen tear. I left the game at 1080 because it doesn't scale text well with it set to 2k or 4k on my 27" 4k monitor. But the upscaling that my monitor did still did this game justice! 
One thing to note is if you are used to controller support from the jump this game doesn't have it. However, you can use Steams built-in support for Playstation, Xbox, steam controller, etc to remap buttons to your controller and play the game that way which is what I did with my PS4 controller! I played this game on Windows and Linux it ran flawlessly on both which is AWESOME! If you are someone that is/has/thinking to switch to Linux, try it out Linux supports has support for so many more games than it used to! If you wanna know my remapping controls I had "W,A,S,D," (movement keys) mapped to the left joystick and the mouse mapped to the right to look around. Had the 'Space Bar' (jump) mapped to  X on PS4 (A on Xbox). E (Grab/interact) mapped to Square (X on Xbox). Left-click mapped to the left trigger aka L2 (LB on Xbox). Right-click mapped to the right trigger aka R2 (RB on Xbox). Hope this helps
В какой раз перепрохожу этот шедевр, жду третью часть, но что-то мне подсказывает что повторится история с Half Life.
Increasingly complex puzzle game with enough training to beat all levels without too many retries. Keeps you engaged throughout.

It's Portal. It's funny, it's got a good level of challenge. And you can beat it in around 3 hours. I've done multiple playthroughs of this game across PC and Xbox 360 via The Orange Box, and if you haven't played this, you're missing out. The sequel is better in my opinion, but pick this up. It's easily worth $40 in my opinion, and it doesn't even cost that

The game has given me remarkably refreshing and relaxing feelings. This futuristic, minimalistic, peaceful, and 'sterile' atmosphere prevailing in Portal 1 is just incredible. Also, Portal Gun is far and away the best item of gear I've ever laid my hands on in any game.
너무 깔끔하고 재밌는 게임이엇습니다 전체적으로 어두운 분위기가 너무 좋았어요 ! 2까지 밖에 없는게 너무 아쉬워요 ㅠㅠ 2절3절 뇌절까지 했으면 좋겠다 생각한 게임은 처음이네요 ㅋㅋ 후속작 제발 나와줘요 ㅠ
This game is very good, the puzzles are fun and make you think, comedy is good. 10/10

This game needs no introduction, the puzzles are great, the atmosphere is fantastic, the visuals are really good for the time, the portal mechanic is fun, and of course GlaDOS is a GOD tier antagonist, i will say  that the game is a bit short for my taste, but since i had so much fun throughout all of those 3 hours, i can't be mad, this is absolutely a game everyone needs to play. 10/10
Very fun and engaging puzzle game despite how short it is. Plethora of extra tougher challenges will keep you coming back, but overall as good as it is I still prefer the second one.
